result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean T. Schuth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If deft successfully completes probation and remains crime free, court will consider expungement on 8/14/15 @ 8:30.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Discharge - Regular on 8-13-15
Discharge - Regular on 8-13-15
on Petition to Expunge Court Record of Conviction - DENIED

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Defendant, Dean Schuth appeared in court in person.  Clerk: PT
ADA Trigg objects to an expungement as DE committed a new crime since this incident.  Court has not received any documentation from probation agent and DE has unpaid court obligations.  Upon hearing arguments motion for expungement is denied by the Court.
$518 court obligations still due.  Discharge date 8-13-15

records.addlTxt: Assessment Report
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Everett King.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Plea of no contest; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation waived by parties.  Sentence withheld, placed on probation for one year w/conditions.  If def. successfully completes probation and remains crime free, court will consider expungement on 8/14/15 at 8:30.
Final pre-trial on August 13, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
